snippet: Among Italy's estimated six million companies, businesses of all sizes have been going belly up at the rate of 1,000 a day over the last year.
abstract: Italy's economy has tumbled into one of worst recessions of any euro zone country since government austerity plan took hold in 2012; among country's estimated six million companies, businesses of all sizes have been going belly up at rate of 1,000 a day over the last year, especially among small and midsize companies that represent backbone of Italy's economy.

byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Rome.

lead_paragraph: Among Italy's estimated six million companies, businesses of all sizes have been going belly up at the rate of 1,000 a day over the last year.
